summary: The Combating Online Fentanyl Trafficking Act aims to incentivize individuals with cyber skills within the Department of Justice to combat fentanyl trafficking. It authorizes the Attorney General to provide incentive pay, up to 25% of basic pay, to employees whose expertise is crucial in detecting, preventing, or prosecuting fentanyl-related crimes. This incentive pay is exempt from certain pay limitations and included in basic pay calculations for retirement purposes.
